title: Printer problems when printing 2 to a page, and
content:
I've checked and I don't think this is the problem that was affecting versions earlier than 90. I'm currently on 91.0.2 I didn't try to update it today but we did when the problem was first occurred.

I've attached a screenshot

This problem only occurs in firefox (but is replicable on 2 other windows machines with firefox over the last 2 weeks) when the following occurs:

  • Printing in firefox (printing to PDF or any Printer doesn't matter)
  • Pages per sheet is set to 2, and pages to print is set to custom and is not printing the whole document.

When this happens, the page will be cut off at the bottom and text will be missing from the printed copy - it's not being pushed further down.

It doesn't occur when we print the whole document. It doesn't occur when we print in other browsers. It did not occur when we printed singular pages per sheet.

We've tried a few different things, such as trying to adjust margins and scaling but haven't been able to resolve the issue other than to switch to a different browser.

Are there any suggestions for a fix or how would I go about filing a bug report?
creator: queenie.eiz

title: N-th tab in firefox doesn't load
content:
Hiya,


I'm having a minor inconvenience with firefox 91.0.2 for a few months now. It's popped up a few months ago and hasn't resolved itself in between updates.

I'm guilty of having many (well over 20) tabs open at the same time and around the 20th or 30th tab even, usually one of the (newly opened) tabs, simply never loads. If I open the same link in another tab, the link (any url) does load. See the screencap below.

This is on a windows 64 bit machine OS build: 19043.1165 (21H1) Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.3530.0

I'm running Norton 360 Antivirus software.

Will try running in safe mode, to see if it still happens and confirm in a reply to this message.

Hoping you guys might have some suggestions.

BTW: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1317506 is probably the same problem, unfortunately the thread has been archived. This one: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1285104 also seems similar.
creator: info6026

title: Hi I dont know if I even understand whats going on but when I download .gba files the files have a Firefox logo on them and they open into firefox and dont work with the applicating I want (Visual Boy Advance)
creator: radgamer1230

title: Opening .txt in file editor, not Firefox
content:
Hi!

Firefox 91.0.2 on Windows 10.

In the options I have set .txt files to open in Notepad++ (see screenshot). However, this does not work. Clicking a hyperlink to a .txt file still opens it in Firefox.

How can I fix this?

Here is a link to a .txt file for testing: https://www.learningcontainer.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/sample-text-file.txt


Possible solutions I found were all on older versions of Firefox and I couldn't get them to work.

Thanks :)
creator: Dettol

title: Firefox has propriety software !
content: Hi, I am a firefox fan for years ! but i found a problem ! there is a propriety application in the open source browser . its pocket . and i was sad to hear that there was a propriety application in this browser since i am an open source fan, i really hate propriety software . so please give an option to remove pocket or replace it with an open-source alternative like wallabag .
creator: deonsebastiandk

title: running Firefox 91.0.32.  menu spacing
content: There is too much spacing in the menus. I've tried adding the userChrome.css and userContent.css files to a chrome folder in my profile folder and that didn't work. Does the name of that file need to be capitalized?

title: Odd, unreadable fonts showing

title: Tab sent from Android device to desktop does not appear
content: I can send a tab from my desktop (Windows 10 Pro 64-bit, Firefox 91.0.2 (64-bit)) to my Android phone Firefox, but when I send a tab to my desktop from Android, it says it was sent on my phone, but it doesn't appear on my desktop until I click Syncing... under my Firefox account tab. Is this how it is supposed to work? I expected to just see the tab appear.
creator: nb8l

title: Firefox will not display a page my Norton Utilities requires to sign-in to norton
content: A page my Norton Security requires to sign in is being blocked by Firefox saying, "Website will not allow Firefox to display the page if another site has embedded it." Can't Firefox and Norton work this out (or tell me how to sign in) when this happens?
creator: stevejsf
